items.name: Lion's Shield
items.text: This steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 36, BT 18) is forged into the shape of a roaring lion's head. The lion's head functions as   that can't be removed from the shield.
items.effect: You animate the lion's head. You Raise the Shield and make a melee Strike with it as part of the same action. The shield's biting maw is a martial melee weapon that deals 2d6 piercing damage and has the deadly 1d6 trait; it can't be enhanced by runes. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, during which time you can Strike with it each time you Raise the Shield, as well as with a Strike action.

items.name: Spellguard Shield
items.text: This shield bears eldritch glyphs to guard against magic. While you have this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) raised, you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as to AC).

items.name: Spined Shield
items.text: Five jagged spines project from the surface of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The spines are  . When you use the  Shield Block  reaction with this shield, the spines take the damage before the shield itself does. When the shield would take damage (after applying Hardness), one spine snaps off per 6 damage, reducing the damage by 6. The shield takes any remaining damage. When there are no spines left, the shield takes damage as normal. When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines regenerate the next day.
items.effect: You shoot one of the shield's spines at a target. A fired spine uses the spikes' statistics, but it is a martial ranged weapon with a range increment of 120 feet.

items.name: Force Shield
items.text: The edges of this elaborately engraved steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) bear tiny glass tiles set in mosaic patterns.
items.effect: The shield surrounds you with a bubble of force that protects you from harm, granting you resistance 5 to physical damage for 1 minute. The bubble disappears if you cease holding the shield.

items.name: Dragonslayer's Shield
items.text: A   is a steel shield covered with dragonhide from a certain type of dragon, which distinguishes each shield from the others. While raised, this steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) grants its circumstance bonus to Reflex saves against area effects (as well as to AC, as normal).  While you hold the shield, it also grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Will saves against a dragon's frightful presence ability. The shield has resistance 10 against the damage type corresponding to the type of dragon whose hide was used in its creation; this applies after reducing the damage for Hardness, so when you use Shield Block, the   takes 18 less damage from attacks of that damage type. You can use Shield Block against attacks that deal damage of that type.

items.name: Forge Warden
items.text: The religious symbol of  Torag , the forge god—an ornate hammer of dwarven construction—adorns the face of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The shield is a religious symbol of Torag.  You and any adjacent allies have fire resistance 5 while you have the shield raised. When used for a Shield Block, the   rings out like the hammer strike of a blacksmith, and the symbol glows as if lit by the fires of a furnace.
items.trigger: You use the forge warden to Shield Block an adjacent creature's attack and the shield takes damage;
items.effect: The attacking creature takes 2d6 fire damage.

The shield magically releases itself and floats off your arm into the air next to you, granting you its bonus automatically, as if you had Raised the Shield. Because you're not wielding the shield, you can't use reactions such as Shield Block with the shield, but you gain its benefits even when using both of your hands. After 1 minute, the shield drops to the ground, ending its floating effect. While the shield is adjacent to you, you can Interact to grasp it, ending its floating effect early.

items.name: Reforging Shield
items.text: This steel shield contains a smoldering core of magma that never cools. Whenever the   current Hit Points are below its Break Threshold, the shield recovers 5 Hit Points at the start of its wielder's turn each round until it is no longer broken. Each time a character Repairs the shield, the shield recovers double the number of Hit Points. The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.
items.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 76

items.name: Nethysian Bulwark
items.text: This round shield is often fashioned to resemble the religious symbol of its dual-natured namesake. A   is a  high-grade cold iron shield  (Hardness 10, HP 40, BT 20) that defends the wielder and can explode with retributive force when struck.
items.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 77
items.trigger: The shield becomes broken when performing a  Shield Block;
items.effect: The shield explodes in a burst of bright light and shadowy tendrils, releasing a 15-foot cone of force that must include the attacker if possible. The cone deals 6d8 force damage to all creatures in the area (DC 34 basic Reflex save).

items.name: Reflecting Shield
items.text: This high-grade silver buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is polished to a mirrorlike sheen. The shield functions as a  spellguard shield  that can also reflect spells.
items.trigger: You are targeted by a spell;
items.effect: You attempt to reflect the spell on its caster, with the effects of a 9th-level  spell turning with a counteract modifier of +40.
items.craftrequirements: Supply one casting of  spell turning, and the initial raw materials must include at least 2,750 gp of silver.
